intro: Maresia pulchella, commonly known as the pretty mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, giving them a fuzzy texture. Maresia pulchella thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks.
